111.title: Weight Gain

An odd artifact has strange results
113.content:
Falahar was more than a little frustrated. His search for a mate had been fruitless, in no small part due to his lacking stature. He was a black dragon, with a dark gray chest and underbelly. While many of his peers in his clan easily broke fifteen feet high on all four legs, Falahar strained to reach ten. Some of the taller humans matched his chest in height, and he was easily the smallest in his colony, only managing to be intimidating with training and some well-placed enchantments. Guys and girls alike turned him down in favor of more sizeable partners.

It didn’t help that he preferred studying the intricacies of magic to any sort of physical activities - so much time cooped up in caves full of books, dashing from project to project, wasn’t exactly the best for a dragon’s health. Even his fellow mages turned him down, either too wrapped up in research of their own or nervous around a dragon with such careless research methods.

His frustrations were compounded by his struggles to bulk up, one way or the other. At first, he thought exercise would solve the problem, but he struggled to maintain a consistent routine, often getting distracted with a new research project. Even with his best efforts to eat healthy and workout, he could never maintain more than a slender, somewhat toned body.

Then, it hit him: why not use magic instead? Falahar was more inclined to magic than most, and if it was successful, he could even help others this way! In a rush, the black dragon began pouring through any source of arcane information he could find for an easy way to put on some muscle, and potentially increase his own height.

Through his latest studies, Falahar found a number of false starts. But eventually, he would find something workable...
113.title: Magic Expansion

choices: Falahar manages to stop the spell, and is only left chubby
Falahar can't stop the spell, and is rendered nearly immobile
Falahar stops the spell, but there will be side effects later
1131.content:
A spell, Falahar decided, would both be the fastest to try and the easiest to get started on. He poured through some healing spells, and discovered one specialized for healing muscles. If done right, this could be changed to build muscle instead. If I can get this to work on myself, Falahar reasoned, there’s no reason I couldn’t get this to work on other dragons, too! I could help everyone bulk up, and there’s no way I wouldn’t get a mate then! Caught up in ambition, the small dragon quickly constructed runes on a copy of the healing spell, not realizing the mistakes he was making in his haste to experiment.

He stuffed the spell page he was working on with some research materials and writing utensils, and took off for an isolated clearing some distance away. Falahar didn’t think to tell anyone where he was going - he wanted this to be a surprise. Immediately upon arriving, the black dragon pulled out his makeshift spell and set to work.

Let’s see… Falahar began forming mana around his body, visualizing the runes on the piece of paper in front of him. As he continued casting, his body began to slump from fatigue, the spell sapped his energy. I’ll need to make this more efficient, but no major issues so far. Finally, as Falahar neared exhaustion, his body flashed with light and the spell was cast.

At first, nothing happened. Falahar waited, eyeing his body from head to tail to try and detect any increase in muscle. Hm… perhaps too much of the original spell was retained. I’m surprised a spell that took up that much energy ended up doing nothing, though… As the black dragon’s thoughts turned inwards, however, changes began occurring all over his body. Slowly, his toned body began to disappear, replaced with layers of adipose. His belly went from near concave, to flat, then started to poke out as if Falahar had just finished a massive meal. The fat spread to the rest of his body, his legs gradually thickening, causing Falahar to subconsciously widen his posture as he paced. As his thighs went from from bony to bubbling, his neck and face became chubbier, the telltale signs of a second chin forming. Even his tail and wings began rounding out at the base, inches piling on as the minutes passed. What was once a thin, toned dragon looked as if he had more than doubled in weight over the last few minutes.

Finally, the dragon stopped his pacing and began to sat down - before realizing he hit the ground far sooner than normal. In a panic, he looked down at his body, terrified of what he saw. His stomach looked bigger than a late-term pregnancy, his legs more than twice as thick as when he first cast the spell. His tail had become far less dexterous, and after getting up in a panic, Falahar noticed his body slightly jiggling with his movements. Of course, Falahar realized, All that mana had to go somewhere! But why would the spell do this?! Panicked, Falahar rushed over to his materials, desperately trying to engineer a counterspell as his frame continued to magically expand.
1131.title: The wrong kind of bigger

choices: Falahar is being filled with some kind of juice
1132.content:
Deep in the back of the library where Falahar spent his time studying, the black dragon found an old, poorly-preserved scroll, seemingly forgotten in the back of the shelf. Pouring through its damaged contents, Falahar soon realized something - this was an ancient set of recipes for potions! The scroll had likely sat undiscovered for decades, maybe even centuries, and described a number of research project undertaken by a mage some time ago.

Each entry in the scroll was made up of a target for the potion, a list of ingredients and preparation instructions, and a description of the potion’s actual results. Most of the experiments ended in duds, or were a less efficient recreation of an already-existing potion, but one in particular caught Falahar’s eye - the very last potion created. The opening statement of this potion seemed to have been damaged; Falahar could just make out a few words - ‘size,’ ‘grow,’ and the like. The ingredients were also unusual - some of the herbs here were either very rare or extinct, and rarely used in alchemy, with the rest being various strengthening agents. Finally, the results section was also greatly diminished, with only one line: ‘Abandoned due to duration of effects.’

Falahr was was fascinated by this potion, and resolved to brew it immediately. If the potion was only a temporary muscle enhancer, then perhaps the addition of some modern techniques could improve the duration, or even make it permanent! Thankfully for the eager dragon, the library was well-stocked with most of the ingredients he would need; the rest would just require some substitutions.

Let’s see here… The black dragon though to himself, organizing glass jars of herbs and beakers of glowing liquids into his pack. I’ll need to go into the woods and gather enough elderflowers, plus I’ll need to find a small lake, but other than that I should be ready.

After sealing his pack and confirming his destination, Falahar sped off into the nearby forest, scanning the trees for the flowers he needed. Not much time had passed before everything was gathered, and the small dragon soon set to work, hoping to cure his diminutive stature.

It took some time before everything was brewed, but Falahar soon had a complete potion in his claws. Despite his earlier excitement, the mage was starting to get nervous. The dark blue, slightly translucent potion shimmered with arcane energy, and seemed stronger than most potions he had encountered. Still, the dragon was focused on his goal, and after steadying himself, leaned his head back and drank the potion in one big *gulp*.

Falahar could immediately tell something was wrong - the potion tasted bitter, and energy crackled on his tongue as the lukewarm liquid slipped into his stomach. The dragon let out a small belch and put a forearm on his paunch to steady it - only for it to swell right underneath his claws. A look down only confirmed his fears, the dragon’s belly sloshing as it filled outwards. In surprise, Falahar instinctively shot upwards, but found flight far more difficult as the liquid weighed him down. It was clear to anyone something was wrong with Falahar, his distended stomach inching outwards.

Realizing that he was going to be grounded soon one way or the other, Falahar landed, his belly scraping the earth as he did so. The dragon was caught off balance by this, and landed on his rear, his paunch pooling in front of him. In a desperate bid to stop the swelling, the dragon tried hugging his stomach with his forearms - but they could barely wrap around his swollen form, and squeezing only succeeded in causing the dragon to let out a loud belch.

By this point, the liquid was starting to pool into other parts of his body - his chest and thighs started to swell, body losing some of its definition as the liquid caused it to grow. Falahar knew he only had so much time before he was rendered too big to move - but in order to engineer some solution to stop the swell, he first had to determine what was inside him in the first place.
1132.title: An ancient potion fills him with liquid

1133.content:
Deep in the bowels of the library, far from where most students of magic studies, Falahar was lost in thought. In his search for magical muscles, the black dragon had only discovered duds, and was now forced to turn to a rather unreliable source - ancient magical relics, stored far below the surface. Distracted as he was, the dragon didn’t notice the figure standing in his way until -

“Oh!” Falahar exclaimed, bumping into the rear of the dragon in front of him before falling on his own behind
“Hm? Is someone there?” The other dragon asked, turning around to face Falahar.

Instantly, Falahar recognized this dragon - it was Haestra, a fellow student and researcher. Haestra was one of many dragons throughout the colony Falahar had a crush on - the researcher was so passionate about his work, and eager to share his findings with others. Falahar could sit and listen to him for hours.

Right now, though, the black dragon had other priorities. “Uh, s-sorry about that, Haestra, didn’t see you there,” Fallahar said, embarrassed. “Oh, it’s all right, I’ve just been doing some reading,” the larger dragon said as he moved to the side. “What brings you down here today?”

“Oh, well, recently I’ve been trying to, ah, p-put on some muscle,” explained Falahar, lightly blushing, “and I thought it would be good to find a relic to help.” “Hmm… I may have something to help with that.” “R-Really!?” Falahar exclaimed. “I’ve been doing some research into this small device.” As he said that, Haestra pulled a small sphere with holes on top from his bags.

“This is some kind of incense burner. The idea is, you place something in here,” Haestra explained as he began lecturing, twisting the top and pulling it off, “and then light it on fire. Then, depending on what’s inside, magical incense is released. We thought there was some symbolic relationship to what is burned and its effects on the user, but right now we’re not sure there’s any correlation…”

As Haestra got caught up in explaining, Falahar sat and admired the dragon before him. Haestra’s scales were a grey-blue color, with a sky blue underbelly and white claws. He towered over Falahar, but was far less intimidating, if only because he didn’t try to be. It was only when Haestra held up a bag that Falahar realized he hadn’t been listening.

“If you could test those combinations for me, that would greatly enhance my research efforts,” Haestra said eagerly. “Uh, s-sure, no problem!” “And as long as you follow my instructions, these ingredients should give you the best chance at the changes you seek.” Wow, thanks so much Haestra! I’ll report back to you as soon as possible!”

Excited by the prospects of his easy solution, Falahar secluded himself a short distance away from the colony. As much as he wanted to get started right away, though, he soon ran into a problem - he didn’t actually know what he was doing.

Rummaging through the bag given to him, the black dragon removed an almost random assortment of items. Some plant specimens here, an animal pelt there - other than all the items nominally being flammable, there was no discernible pattern. Falahar vaguely remembered something about what to combine with what, but couldn’t remember the specifics.

Urg… I don’t want to have to go back and ask Haestra what to do again, then he’d know I wasn’t listening to him. Hm… I’ll just put a little bit of everything in, what’s the worst that could happen? Falahar took a little bit of every ingredient he had retrieved into the burner, then lit it with a quick burst of flame and stepped back.
1133.title: Incense

choices: ...But they get caught in the incense
11331.content:
As the incense burner caught aflame, a shimmering, light crimson smoke began emanating from it, clouding the air. Falahar leaned in and took a deep sniff, muscles relaxing and face forming a relaxed smile as the surprisingly pleasant scent filled his lungs.

Huh, maybe mixing it all together wasn’t such a bad idea after all. This is pretty relaxing… The black dragon took a particularly large breath, his chest and stomach lightly swelling with air, and appreciated the aroma before breathing out.

What the dragon failed to notice, however, was that each breath out did not cause his stomach to return to normal - in fact, every breath Falahar took of the incense was steadily bloating him outwards, each one more than the last. As his belly and chest continued to grow, the expansion spread out to Falahar’s entire torso.

After about half a minute of appreciating the incense in silence, Falahar realized something was wrong, and looked down at his chest. By that point, his torso had grown considerably wider, and was starting to hamper the dragon’s movements with his limbs. Startled, Falahar pushed his arms against his bloated belly in a meager attempt to stop the expansion, but only managed a slight indent. His hide grew more and more taught, and his scales began spreading out, unable to cover the whole body.

By now, Falahar’s uncontrollable expansion had caused him another problem - his limbs were beginning to be swallowed by his growing torso, threatening to render the dragon immobile. But by the time the black dragon realized this, he had yet to make a move distancing himself from the source of his increase in size - the burner. If the dragon’s growth continued unabated, he would become spherical, stranded in the clearing until someone rescued him.

Falahar rushed away from the device - or tried to, anyways. his inflating body spread his legs wide, forcing him into a slow waddle. His belly had grown to the point it scraped the dirt underneath the dragon, making a small divot and slowing his progress further.. The dragon attempted to take off, but by this point his wings had been constricted, not able to provide the level of control required. Falahar’s waddle slowed to a crawl, then a standstill as his body continued to grow and constrict his limbs, his face tipping forward from his forward velocity. By this point, Falahar was downright spherical, his head and limbs barely sticking out from the rest of his body.

The black dragon could do little more than wiggle his body or turn his head slightly - most other motion was off-limits by this point. The dragon was now a near-perfect sphere, his head barely sticking out of his body, with only the tips of his claws and hind legs visible. The black ball’s tail had also bloated considerably, thickening with air to match his body’s expansion. And as the dragon sat there, he felt a faint tug upwards - Falahar was floating! In a panic, the sphere opened his maw as wide as he could, and clamped down on a nearby branch. Although the dragon was safe from floating away, he showed no signs of deflating on his own, and the incense was still burning away…

12.content:
Ryuuka the red dragon lay in his den one sunny morning in May, having spent the previous night terrorising human villages for his own amusement, now laying on his side in his cave, he snoozed with a smirk on his muzzle.

Soon, the young dragon finally woke up, yawning as he stretched his legs, sharp claws digging little divots into the earth at his feet, shaking his head some, his long crimson mane falling over his yellow eyes as he trod out into the morning sunlight, laying down on a rock to sun himself.

"heh, stupid humans always make the funniest noises when i burn their houses down." he chuckled to himself, remembering the previous nights 'fun' vividly, having crept into the village under the cover of night, he set fire to their gunpowder reserves and made off with two lovely plump cows as a prize, smirking as the remnants of the meal still kept him licking his lips in pleasure.

"oh? and just how many houses did you burn down this time Ryuuka?" came a stern feminine voice, shocking Ryuuka into a sitting position, looking round with a fearful look at the large blue female sat behind him, eyes clearly unimpressed.

"L-Lilika h-hey, whats up...?" Ryuuka stammered out, trying to act casual as he looked at his crush, blushing some. Lilika sighed, shaking her head. "Honestly Ryuu, how many times have the elder dragons told you NOT to cause trouble for the humans? its because of stunts like these that they hate us so much." she scolded, making the smaller dragon male adopt a more submissive stance.

"...about fourteen times...probably fifteen now..." Ryuu muttered, making Lilika groan as she sat down heavily. Lilika, unlike most dragons her age, was quite large, and not in terms of sheer size. If a human saw her, they would probably say she was fat, like obese levels of fat, her crystal blue scales shone bright across her large belly, strong as steel, but soft due to the fat they enclosed, her legs were wide and meaty, like cones, giving her a visible waddle when she walked, her rump was massive, her fat tail draped over it lazily, and her mane was pure white, long enough to fall over her green eyes some.

Despite the criticism she received for her weight from the elders, Lilika was one of the most coveted dragoness' in their colony, having turned down many a horny male during breeding season, and only really speaking to Ryuuka out of them all.

"Thats just it Ryuu, the elders are deciding your punishment as we speak..." she said, frowning at Ryuu, who looked shocked.

"P-Punishment!? b-but i didn't think it warranted punishment..." he said, quivering as he knew how harsh the elders got during punishments, cowering like a newborn hatchling.

Likila sighed. "doesn't matter what you thought, now come on, they asked me to fetch you." she said, giving him the stern gaze he knew he couldn't refuse, making him whimper and follow her swaying rump through the forest to the 'Dragons village' within the nearby mountain, having to help Lilika get through one of the smaller entrances.

Inside on of the large chambers, there sat five gigantic elder dragons, each the size of a human village, dwarfing the adolescent dragons before them. Ryuuka sat at the center of their gaze, small and helpless as he looked up at the elders, who all gazed at him thoughtfully.

"Ryuuka...are you ready to receive your punishment...?" the central elder, Skaldanir asked, his voice calm and authoritative, enough so to make Ryuuka a bit more relaxed, he knew that no matter what his punishment was, a dragon would never kill another dragon.

"Y-Yes...Elder Skaldanir..." he said, still afraid, but willing to atone. Skaldanir sighed, nodding. "very well, your punishment will be...

Meanwhile, in a far off castle, the home of Gellot the Great, one of the greatest, and most just wizards of all time, and head envoy between dragons and humans. The wizard sat in his library, drinking a cup of tea and sighing to himself as he stroked his long white beard, anxiety building in the pit of his stomach as he looked to the setting sun in the sky.

"...oh meridian preserve us...I do not know how much longer i can go on like this..." he said to himself, taking a sip of his tea as he tried to ease his mind, thoughts of the last dragon attack still fresh in his mind. It was true he had a very strong friendship with the elders of the dragon colony in the mountains, but, to his regret, it seemed that with every generation of adolescents after those elders there were more who deemed humanity as ilk instead of equals, as they had been established during the long pact years, with more and more young dragons attacking villages and being slain by knights out of vengeance, it was horrid, the peace treaty was holding back all out war by the thinnest of threads, but he dreaded the day when the dragons unanimously decided they were better than humans, for the war that would come after that would be a horrid and messy affair to say the least.

Looking out the window, he smirked as he saw his young apprentice Wallin, doing his chores magically around the castle farm, tending to the cattle and other animals with care, however, as he watched, he saw his student bring one severely emaciated calf they'd found a while back out into the middle of the courtyard, before standing before it and preparing to cast a spell, piquing the old wizard's interest as he leant against the windowsill watching, then his eyes went wide as the thin, bony calf swelled out, growing fat and healthy, then even more so, then to his astonishment, the calf became a large ball of fat, head, hoofs, tail and udder sticking out of its round engorged body at the ends of cone like limbs, a fat neck and stumpy tail base, making the wizard remove his glasses to check he wasn't seeing things.

Wallin seemed just as surprised as his instructor, staring at the huge ball of a cow in amazement, before getting up to check the beast was alright, and sighing with relief as the calf gently nuzzled his hand affectionately, that being one of the few acts of movement it could manage as the young apprentice slowly rolled it to a stall, magically enlarging it to make room for the calf.

Gellot watched in amusement, smirking, before his mind began to wander, wondering what that spell would do to a dragon, which made him laugh, before realizing the idea wasn't as mad as he first thought, quickly running down to his apprentice, the gears in his head turning.

125231.content:
The next morning the swordswoman explained to Ryuuka that he needed to head to Coalburn Caverns to mine dexterium. A rare material that is said to be formed when diamonds are enchanted with magic. The Coalburn Caverns is the only place to find them, but rumors have it that they can regenerate as long as they retain their magic. So Ryuuka flew to the caverns and preceded to enter.

"This is the first time I've been here. There should be a few dragons around that should know where this dexterium is. The sooner I rebuild those villages the more time I'll have to get fat for Lilika, yet I wonder if she'll mind some extra muscle though. Defibtely don't want to become a brood father. Those guys are fat beyond belief and all they do is mate and eat all day." Ryuuka said to himself.

AS Ryuuka went deeper into the cavern he could hear heavy grunts. He was certain he ran into some of his kind. When Ryuuka peered into the chamber his mouth dropped as he saw three extremely buff adults carrying large slabs of minerals. The adolescent became nervous, since he won't become an adult until he's mated at least once. For dragons the mating ritual marks the first steps of adulthood and it's not until after mating that dragons go through strange growth spurts ranging from buff or obese and usually gaining a few feet in height immediately after unlike the slow growth of adolescents.

"Yo! I need some dexterium! I'll just go take some if you're too busy!" Ryuuka said as he started using his tail to grab some minerals.

"Hold a moment kid! Aren't you supposed to be serving your punishment and not fooling around here," glared the massive green and white dragon.

"That's what I'm doing. I found a lead on the warlock, but my source refuses to tell me until I rebuild the villages I burned down." Ryuuka replied.

"Looks like Skaldanir knew what he was doing when he sent you on that mission with Lilika. My younger bro. was burning with jealousy when he found out that you two were sent out together. He's been trying to come up with a way to attract Lilika from right out under your claws." The silver dragon replied.

"I found out what attracts Lilika. She's not interested in males smaller than her." Ryuuka said hoping not to reveal too much about his plan.

"That rules out almost every adolescent and by big she probably means a tough and sturdy dragon with a big appetite. The Blue and gold dragon said. "Go ahead kid and take what you need. Carrying this stuff should really help you get stronger. It's incredibly heavy.

Ryuuka picks up a shard of dexterium and is surprised to find the material nearly weighing him down.

"This stuff is heavy. I'll have to take over one piece at a time. Thanks dudes.

Ruyuuka than leaves with a small bag of dexterium which was starting to regenerate as he walked back to the village. It was nightfall when Ryuuka arived and he was starving. The swordswoamn gives Ryuuka to bulls to devour for his hard work. Tomorrow Ryuuka would have to use his fire breath to sculpted the dexterium into a wall and start using it around the houses. 13.content:
It was a long night. Mei had just finished raiding a city, but the reason is not what most of her kind would assume. Unlike Ryuuka who does it out of fun, Mei does it to liberate people from corruption. She had just finished scaring the warlord of the city into treaty his people like they're actual people and tools to meet an end. This however was against dragon law. Dragon law states that dragons are not to meddle in human affairs, and that it is up to the dragon elders to decide whether to intervene or not, but Mei's sense of justice causes more harm than good.

"What a night. Hopefully that human warlord learned his lesson. I can't scum like him are let loose."

Mei manages to get some rest before a guest appeared. By then she was awake. A grin formed on her muzzle as remembered the previous night's heroics. Her white mane partially draped her back as she stood on her feet.

"Last night was great. Hopefully that tyrannical warlord learned his lesson."

"Tell me more. How many homes did you scorch just to bring justice one man to justice?" came a deep and powerful masculine voice, shocking Mei into a sitting position. She then gazes at the large green male with an embarrassed look who's eyes showed disappointment.

"Dra... Draxius! I didn't mean to. I was just trying to rescue them from a tyrant. No one died or got hurt, so it can't be that bad, right?" Mei said in the calmest tone possible as she looked at her crush, while blushing a bit. Draxius sighed and shook his head. "I understand Mei, but the elders specifically told you NOT to meddle in the affairs of humans. It's due to your recklessness that humans hate us!" Draxius said in a scolding tone. Mei stared at the larger male dragon with shock. She wanted to protest, but the disappointment in Draxius' eyes made her at a loss for words. After regaining some composure Mei's ego came out with vengeance.

"At least I'm proactive. I've saved countless lives! Humans should be thankful that I saved them from tyranny."

Draxius shakes his head. "You don't get it. The elders are waiting for you. I was asked to fetch you." Draxius groaned.

Now Draxius wasn't like other dragons his age. He's one of the largest dragons in the colony, but not only for his size. If seen by a human they would consider him obese. His emerald scales glistened brightly across his massive belly and was strong as diamond, but also soft due to his multiple layers of fat. His legs were thick and meaty. Many would say that Draxius was stronger than most given to all the weight he carries everyday. Whenever he walked it was he had a heavy waddle that would cause the ground to shake if he didn't tread lightly. His rear was huge and his fat tail casually covered it. His mane was jet black, but it was shorter than Mei's. His red eyes added some ferocity to his usually cuddly appearnce.

Despite criticism from the elders, Draxius was the most coveted male. He would often turn away many a pervy female during breeding season, and only speaking to Mei.

"Let's go. The elders are deciding your punishment as we speak."

"Punishment! Why should I get punished for stopping evil!" Mei said, as a tear rolled down her face.

"It doesn't matter. You deliberately broke dragon law. You should have asked the elders before going on your own."

Mei was fuming, but she sighed as she followed her hefty companion to the Dragons' Village in the nearby mountain. Mei even helped Draxius get through the smaller openings. Once inside Mei was overcome with remorse as the village sized elders gazed down at her.

"You know why you are here." A female elder boomed.

"I know, but..."

"We don't want to hear it. Your intentions are noble, but you often forget that your actions have consequences. It's counterproductive to save a village if you almost destroy it in the process." The central elder said.

"I realize that Lord Skaldanir. But you don't realize that there's a tyrant who's been kidnapping hatch..."

"Actually we are aware, but you can't just rush in there. Therefore your punishment is..."
